result.execSummary:
All charges against Klemisha M Richardson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Klemisha M Richardson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Klemisha M Richardson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Klemisha M Richardson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. For reasons set forth in the record, State motions to dismiss. Defense has no objection.
On State's motion, Court orders case dismissed and the terms of bail/bond terminated and any cash on deposit returned to whoever posted it.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/17/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Klemisha M Richardson in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 1p
